  physical_appearance: This stoneware mortar has a circular shape
 with a hollow center. The exterior of the mortar is carved with ribs
 resembling a cog. It is covered with a dark-brown glaze. The glaze is uneven
 especially along the bottom. The edges of the mortar
 especially along the exterior ridges
 are faded.

  subject_terms_1: kitchenware ceramics (object genre)

  subject_terms_2: Kitchen utensils Ceramics China History Song dynasty
 960-1279 Mortars

  subject_terms_3: Ceramics

  sgcool_label_text: This heavily-potted stoneware mortar is carved with ribs around the exterior
 resembling a cog. It is covered with a dense
 darkly-brown glaze that thins at the extremities of the ribs to reveal a buff body beneath. At the same time
 the glaze pools to thick drops around the base. Vessels of such form were sometimes thought to have been used as a bowl for offerings. However
 the heaviness of this example indicates it was most probably used as a mortar
 possibly for the preparation of food or medicinal ingredients.

metadata.physical_appearance: This stoneware mortar has a circular shape, with a hollow center. The exterior of the mortar is carved with ribs, resembling a cog. It is covered with a dark-brown glaze. The glaze is uneven, especially along the bottom. The edges of the mortar, especially along the exterior ridges, are faded.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Kitchen utensils Ceramics China History Song dynasty, 960-1279 Mortars
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This heavily-potted stoneware mortar is carved with ribs around the exterior, resembling a cog. It is covered with a dense, darkly-brown glaze that thins at the extremities of the ribs to reveal a buff body beneath. At the same time, the glaze pools to thick drops around the base. Vessels of such form were sometimes thought to have been used as a bowl for offerings. However, the heaviness of this example indicates it was most probably used as a mortar, possibly for the preparation of food or medicinal ingredients.
